items.title: Top San Francisco Lawmaker Expected to Challenge Nancy Pelosi in Primary
items.summary: Ms. Pelosi, 85, has not yet said whether she will run again. The challenge would be the latest example of the Democratic Party facing a push for generational change.

items.title: Salesforce Offers Its Services to Boost Trump’s Immigration Force
items.summary: The San Francisco-based firm has told ICE that it could use A.I. to help the agency nearly triple its staff. The company’s C.E.O., once a progressive tech titan, has embraced President Trump.

items.title: In Virginia A.G. Debate, Spotlight Is on Democratic Candidate’s Violent Texts
items.summary: Jay Jones apologized for his threatening messages and tried to tie his opponent, Jason Miyares, to President Trump’s policies.

items.title: Small Plane Crashes in Michigan, Killing 3
items.summary: The cause of the plane crash was not immediately known, officials said.

items.title: Police Warn Against Pranking People With A.I. Images of Homeless Intruder
items.summary: Law enforcement departments in several states said that an online trend in which people are tricked into believing a homeless man is in their homes could have dangerous consequences.

items.title: How the Bolton Indictment Compares to Trump’s Classified Documents Case
items.summary: Some charges against the onetime national security adviser resemble the dropped case against President Trump, but there are also differences.

items.title: Experience, integrity and Trump: key takeaways from New York’s mayoral debate
items.summary: <p>Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo tried to knock each other down while Curtis Sliwa took shots at both</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/zohran-mamdani">Zohran Mamdani</a>, the Democratic nominee and current frontrunner for New York City mayor, faced off with <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/andrew-cuomo">Andrew Cuomo</a>, the former New York governor now running as an independent, and Curtis Sliwa, the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/republicans">Republican</a> candidate, at the first New York mayoral election debate on Thursday night.</p><p>Here are some key takeaways from the evening.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/16/key-takeaways-new-york-mayoral-debate">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Mamdani, Cuomo and Sliwa spar in New York mayoral debate
items.summary: <p>The Democratic nominee and the former governor of New York clashed repeatedly, while Sliwa criticized them both</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/new-york">New York City</a>’s three mayoral candidates faced off on Thursday night in the first of two televised debates, less than three weeks before voters head to the polls.</p><p>On stage were Democratic nominee <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/zohran-mamdani">Zohran Mamdani</a>, former governor <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/andrew-cuomo">Andrew Cuomo</a> – now running as an independent after <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jun/24/new-york-mayoral-primary-results">losing the Democratic primary to Mamdani</a> in June – and Republican nominee <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ng-interactive/2025/oct/14/curtis-sliwa-nyc-republican-mayoral-candidate">Curtis Sliwa</a>. Mayor Eric Adams, who <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/28/eric-adams-drops-out-new-york-mayor-race">dropped</a> out of the race several weeks ago, did not participate.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/16/mamdani-cuomo-sliwa-new-york-mayoral-debate">Continue reading...</a>
